alert.note: Alert for Henry; Putnam (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 06 at 6:29PM EDT until June 06 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN HENRY AND CENTRAL PUTNAM COUNTIES... At 627 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen, with this axis of heavy rain from roughly Ottoville to Miller City to Deshler. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ottawa, Leipsic, Deshler, Kalida, Glandorf, Ottoville, Fort Jennings, West Leipsic, Belmore, Miller City, Prentiss and Gallup. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
